intro: Klainedoxa gabonensis var. microphylla, commonly known as the Gabon wax tree, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and sumac. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-white flowers. It is often found in moist, tropical lowland forests. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local communities.
